page.title: 11Neighbourhood Policing
page.content: A few years ago you could hardly recognize your local policman because} they used to always drive around in panda cars and only turned up at crimes.Now most areas have a {Neighbourhood Beat Officer (N.B.O.)} who is responsible for a particular area. 90% of his time is spent walking or cycling most of his time is spent {visiting schools}and walking the beat and checking property.He has 8 ways of getting to know his area. He visits our school and groups and organisations. He holds a{police {surgery}for half an hour in the village hall once a month.He goes to {parish council meetings}and gets to know shop holders. He writes in the Inkstand and runs an{attendance {centre }on saturdays for young people who have been in trouble with the law.
